title: Fix Qwen OAuth token not used (api_key enrichment)
description:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Run `routecodex oauth ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-1-default.json` and complete OAuth.
2. Token file contains `access_token`/`refresh_token` but no `api_key`.
3. Start RouteCodex and route a request to Qwen (e.g. background route `qwen.qwen3-coder-plus`).
4. Observe server still fails auth / appears not to use token.

## Acceptance Criteria
- When Qwen token file is missing `api_key`, RouteCodex backfills it via Qwen user-info endpoint and persists it (without requiring token refresh).
- CLI init provider catalog uses `~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-1-default.json` by default.
- `npm run build:dev` passes (includes `install:global`).
notes:
- Code: src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts (Qwen api_key enrichment)
- Config: src/cli/config/init-provider-catalog.ts (tokenFile now qwen-oauth-1-default.json)
- Test: tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.qwen-enrich.spec.ts (PASS)
- Commit: 9e9ce8769
- Verification: npm run build:dev (includes install:global) completed successfully on 2026-02-03.
close_reason: Implemented Qwen api_key enrichment + default tokenFile alignment
